author: DAN HOEHNE Daily Press Sports Writer
title: Indians slip to 2nd with loss
text:
Close   file photo 
Arjun Singh and the Montrose soccer team were stopped in their tracks Satuday, as Durango halted their five-game winning streak. top story Indians slip to 2nd with loss Demons take SWL lead with 1-0 victory By DAN HOEHNE Daily Press Sports Writer Oct 18, 2015 0   file photo 
Arjun Singh and the Montrose soccer team were stopped in their tracks Satuday, as Durango halted their five-game winning streak. 
Montrose soccer had been cruising right along, winning five in a row and having the upper hand in the Southwestern League standings heading into the final two matches of the regular season. 
But things came to a screeching halt Saturday afternoon as the team traveled down to Durango, and were downed by the Demons by a 1-0 score. 
The Indians had scored 18 goals and given up just four during their five-game winning streak, but couldn’t solve the Durango defense this day. 
Problem now is, the Demons (5-1-1) snuck ahead of Montrose (5-2) for first place in the standings by a half game, with a league title likely holding the key to hosting at least the first match of the postseason. 
Each team has one game left to play, with the Indians traveling to third-place Grand Junction Tuesday, while Durango will host Fruita Monument Friday, Oct. 23. ×
